childMarkdownRemark.html: A one year Cloud Native program covering Docker, Terraform, Kubernetes, Helm, Operators, Istio, Knative, GitOps, and cloud native patterns using the multicloud strategy.

content.value: A one year Cloud Native program covering Docker, Terraform, Kubernetes, Helm, Operators, Istio, Knative, GitOps, and cloud native patterns using the multicloud strategy. The program consists of tracks (sequence of courses which run in parallel):
Cloud Native Technical Track (3 hr/wk, consisting of four quarters)
Innovation Track (2 hr/wk, starting from Quarter 2, consisting of four quarters)
Application Development Track (2 hr/wk, starting from Quarter 2, consisting of four quarters)
In the main cloud native technical track we cover these areas: Docker, Terraform, Kubernetes, Helm, Kubernetes Operators, Istio, Knative, GitOps, and cloud native patterns.

In the innovation track we will cover both the art and science of innovation. Our innovation model combines Design Thinking, Lean Startup, Agile and DevOps. We will cover the following technologies in this track: Linux, Git, Docker Containers, Terraform, Serverless Containers, and CI/CD pipelines.

We are making the innovation track compulsory because it has always been an efficient and effective tool to resolve the challenges we face in software development. However, in this new era of digital restoration during and after the COVID-19 crisis, digital innovation will play a major part in restoring global prosperity. In the long term, the crisis will spur
and stimulate advancements in digital technology. Digital innovation and AI technologies will have to play a major part we want to have our lives back.

In the application development track we will learn how to build end-to-end web applications using the JAMstack and MERN stack. The following technologies will be covered JavaScript, React, Progressive Web App (PWA), Gatsby, Headless CMS, Node.js/Express and MongoDB.
The innovation and the application development track classes will start in the second quarter of the program in parallel to the main AI technical track.

childMarkdownRemark.html: Automating the deployment, scaling and management of microservices-based containerized mordern applications. This technical track will provide a solid foundation in cloud native concepts and technologies. Innovation and application development track will supplement the cloud native techniques and will develop the necessary skills to build end-to-end smart applications.

content.value: Core Language: HCL
Main Libraries and Frameworks: Docker, Terraform, Kubernetes, Helm, Kubernetes Operators, Istio, Knative, Cloud Native DevOps, Jenkins, and Morpheus.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Linux containers are poised to take over the world; we will start this quarter with an introduction of Linux and the command line. For many non-technical people, the command line (also referred to as CLI, Terminal, bash, or shell) is a place of mystery. However, you only have to know a handful of basic commands to start feeling comfortable. In this quarter we will cover the basic commands to get you started.

From the Linux command line we will move to learning core Docker technologies, including the Docker Engine, Images, Containers, Registries, Networking, Storage, and more. All of the behind the scenes theory will be explained, and all concepts are clearly demonstrated on the command line.

After we have mastered the containers we will move towards learning Kubernetes. The Kubernetes container orchestration system safely manages the structure and flow of a distributed application, organizing containers and services for maximum efficiency. Kubernetes serves as an operating system for your clusters, eliminating the need to factor the underlying network and server infrastructure into your designs. In this course we will teach you to use Kubernetes to deploy container-based distributed applications. We will start with an overview of Docker and Kubernetes before building your first Kubernetes cluster. We'll gradually expand your initial application, adding features and deepening your knowledge of Kubernetes architecture and operation. We'll explore high-value topics like monitoring, tuning, and scaling. By the end of the quarter you will be able to appear in the Certified Kubernetes Application Developer (CKAD) exam.

This track is designed to help students become innovation leaders, startup founders, software project managers, entrepreneurs, intrapreneurs, and freelancers working on disruptive new products and services. The innovation track will supplement the main technical tracks by providing the knowledge about art of innovation.

content.value: This track is compulsory for all students and designed to help them become innovation leaders, startup founders, software developers and software project managers, entrepreneurs, intrapreneurs, and freelancers working on (disruptive) new products and services within a larger enterprise or a small startup in the fourth industrial revolution era.

Innovation has always been an efficient and effective tool to resolve the challenges we face in software development. However, in this new era of digital restoration during and after the COVID-19 crisis, digital innovation will play a major part in restoring global prosperity. In the long term, the crisis will spur and stimulate advancements in digital technology. Digital innovation and AI technologies will have to play a major part we want to have our lives back.
We will learn that innovation demands a combination of iterative, experimental approaches (Source: Gartner):

Use Design Thinking to Understand the Customer and
Discover the Real Need
Evolve the Innovation Using Lean Startup
Use Agile to Build Out and Evolve the Technology Elements of the Innovation
DevOps to continuously deliver innovation to the customer

By combining design thinking, the lean startup, agile and DevOps, you are far more likely to not only come up with better ideas but turn those ideas into viable money makers and deliver them in a way that creates immediate value for customers, doesn’t result in cost and schedule blowouts - synonymous with innovation at large companies - and give
your employees the opportunity to partake in more rewarding and fulfilling work.

In the innovation track we will cover both the art and science of innovation.  We will also cover the following technologies in the DevOps part of the track: Linux, Git, Docker Containers, Terraform, Serverless Containers, and CI/CD pipelines.

childMarkdownRemark.html: In this course we will teach you the innovation process which begins with vision and then focuses on customers and aims to quickly and iteratively build an innovation to become a "minimum viable product (MVP)" which the customer can use and we can find out if the product has demand. Our innovation model combines Design Thinking, Lean Startup, Agile Project Management, and DevOps. In this course we will start covering the art of innovation. Design Thinking, Lean Startup and introduction to Agile will be covered in this course.

This course is the second course in the innovation track which is designed to cover the science of innovation. In this course we will learn how to develop infrastructure as code for your startup and enterprise. We will also learn to use DevOps tools to deploy our innovation so that the customers can get access to it right away. DevOps is an amazing software development methodology that combines software development (Dev) with IT operations (Ops) participating together in the entire service life-cycle, from design through the development process to production, it is a set of practices that automate the processes between software development and IT teams, in order that they can build, test, and release software faster. We will start this course by learning Linux, Git and Docker, the tools most used by DevOps engineers. Then we will shift our focus on how to deploy serverless containers with Terraform on Google Cloud Run, AWS Fargate, and Azure Container Instances. We will also learn how to build continuous integration, delivery and deployment pipelines. At the end of this course we will learn how to do event monitoring and alerting for our cloud deployments.

JAMstack and MERN Full Stack Development. This track will provide a solid foundation in application development concepts and technologies. This application development track will supplement the main technical tracks and will develop the necessary skills to build end-to-end applications.

content.value:
This track is designed for the absolute beginners in mobile web full stack development and
builds a solid foundation in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, React, QraphQL, Express/Node.js, MongoDB, Contentful, and Gatsby.js.

childMarkdownRemark.html: This module focuses on the fundamentals of mobile web development. It assumes no prior programming experience on the part of the student. After covering HTML and CSS you'll learn about the syntax and structure of the JavaScript language including operators and expressions, control structures, methods, and arrays. At the end of the course, an introduction to JAMstack will be given using Gatsby.js, Contentful and Netlify.

In this course we will not only develop expertise in Advanced JavaScript but also learn React and QraphQL. In the next quarter we will learn to develop and deploy static and dynamic enterprise PWA web apps with JAMstack and MERN stack.
Advanced JS Topics Covered Before starting React: Object Oriented ES6 Arrow function, This keyword in Arrow function Advance array functions like filter, find, and map

Advanced JS Topics Covered When Required in React: Variable Hoisting Function Hoisting Let Const Template Literals Destructuring (Array and Object) Rest operator Spread operator Object Literal Shorthand For in Loop For of Loop Object.keys Object.values Object.assign Default Values Set Local storage Session storage Try, catch and throw Conditional (Ternary) Operators Short circuit evaluation ( && || ) Async JS (promises, async/await, callbacks)

Additional Reading Material https://medium.com/simply/state-management-with-react-hooks-and-context-api-at-10-lines-of-code-baf6be8302c https://blog.logrocket.com/use-hooks-and-context-not-react-and-redux/ https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/state-management-with-react-hooks/
